text: I couldn’t stop myself. I stared into her eyes and pressed on: “What is this place, exactly? And why do you seem so familiar with it?”
The space between Alicia’s brows twitches, just slightly. Not anger—something closer to exhaustion, like a wound being poked.
“You just said ‘we’ll need it again tomorrow’—what are you actually planning to do?”
Her voice isn’t loud, but it cuts cleanly—like a sharp blade severing the conversation outright.
“What you should be doing right now is taking Lucia back.”
When she says it, she isn’t looking at me, but deeper into the fading glow of the formation—like she’s checking that some ‘position’ hasn’t shifted.
Lucia quickly tugs at my sleeve and whispers, “Innkeeper… let’s go back first. She really shouldn’t be pressed right now.”
I want to speak again, but Alicia has already turned and taken a single step toward the stairs—light, but instinctively silencing.
She leaves me no room for explanation, like she’s pushed me straight out of her world.
